page.title: 14PARISH COUNCIL/ HALL
page.content: Gt Oakley has 7 Parish Councillors who are{elected}for 3 years.The people who live here vote for the council.The council looks after street lights,the village hall,the playing fields,the {burial grounds}and keeping the grass and streets tidy.A part-time{clerk}is paid to see these jobs are done.The money comes from Tendring council {rates. The{Village Hall}was built by the League of Friends in the 1950s but it now belongs to the Parish Council. It is on the{Harwich Road,}down a short drive. A sub_committee, made up of all the{village clubs}who use the hall regularly, hires out the hall. People from outside the village pay more than village clubs. Oakstones,W.I.,Youth Club and playgroup are all held in the village hall.
